net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.param
Class JSMetaParam

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.param.Parameter
      net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.param.MetaParameter
          net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.param.JSMetaParam
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleParameter
public class JSMetaParam
extends MetaParameter

This meta param will take a single parameter named "script" and run the script against the values using BeanShell. The variables substitutions are done before hand though. Variables are named as

getParamValue

public double getParamValue(java.lang.String paramName)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
This is a simple method used by the shell script to get the parameter values for the given name. The generated script will have this method embedded to simplify value fetching.

Parameters:
paramName - IN - the parameter name to get the value for.
Returns:
IN - the parameter value.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getValue

public double getValue()
Returns:

setValue

public void setValue(double val)
This method is used by the beanshell script to set the value variable. This is just to simplify the setting of this meta-parameters return value.

Parameters:
val - IN - the value to set.

makeint

public double makeint(int highByte,
                      int lowByte)
This utility function is made available to the shell script for the purpose of taking a highbyte and a low byte, and makeing them into a single int value.

Parameters:
highByte - IN - the high byte of the int.
lowByte - IN - the low byte of the int.
Returns:
the resulting int, but in double format. We return the value as a double, to help enforse double int point precision from within the shell script.

bitcheck

public double bitcheck(int paramValue,
                       int bit)
This utility funciton is available to the bean shell for generating a 1 or 0 from a bitmask.

Parameters:
paramValue - IN - the parameter value to bitcheck.
bit - IN - the bit to check. the bit order for a byte is "76543210"
Returns:
a 1 if the bit is set, a 0 if the bit is not set.

bitShiftRight

public long bitShiftRight(double d,
                          int bits)
This utility method simply converts the double to a long, then shifts the bits right "bits" number of bits.

Parameters:
d -
bits -
Returns:
